text: Louis Sebastian Theroux (born 20 May 1970) is an English-American broadcaster. He is best known for his investigative series such as When Louis Met, Louis Theroux's Weird Weekends, Louis Theroux's BBC Two Specials. Theroux was born in Singapore and is a dual citizen. He moved to London when he was a year old. He was educated at Westminster School and Magdalen College, Oxford where he gained a degree in history. In 2013, he moved to Los Angeles. Theroux's mother is British; his father is American writer Paul Theroux. He is an atheist.www.celebatheists.com ==References== == Other websites == * Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:American atheists Category:American television personalities Category:American television producers Category:American television writers Category:English atheists Category:English television producers Category:English television writers Category:People educated at Westminster School, London Category:Television personalities from London Category:Writers from London
title: Louis Theroux
